revised_title: Investigation of the Dissociation Pressures and Melting Points of the Copper-Cuprous Oxide System
tldr: The authors investigate the dissociation pressures and melting points of the copper-cuprous oxide system, finding that mixtures with compositions between 20% and 95% cuprous oxide separate into two layers above 1195°C. The melting point of pure cuprous oxide is approximately 1210°C. The phase rule is used to determine the type of pressure-temperature diagram for the system.
